description: This village in south Cumbria is located just a few miles east of the famous Lake Windermere in the Lake District. You're also close to Morecambe Bay where you can enjoy waterside walks in Grange-over-Sands and Cartmel. This circular walk from the village visits Yewbarrow and the Whitbarrow National Nature Reserve. There's some splendid limestone scenery and excellent views from the high points on the walk. The walk starts in the village next to the old church. From here you can follow footpaths up to Yewbarrow where there are some fine views to the surrounding fells. You continue up to Whitbarrow and the Lord's Seat, another fine viewpoint. The route then loops through the nature reserve before turning west through Mill Side to return to the village.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village you can enjoy some post walk rest and refreshment at The Derby Arms. The pub has a charming interior with cosy log fires and period furniture. Outside there's a large garden which hosts a weekly onsite popup pizza restaurant, Great Lakes Pizza. You can find them at postcode LA11 6RH for your sat navs. The pub is also dog friendly if you have your canine friend with you.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the east of the village there's the Foulshaw Moss Nature Reserve. The reserve has some nice boardwalks to follow over the peat bog. It's also excellent for wildlife with ospreys, hobby, sparrowhawk, buzzard and peregrine to look out for from the bird hides.

display_address: Church Road, Witherslack, Meathop and Ulpha, Witherslack, Westmorland and Furness, England, LA11 6RS, United Kingdom
